intro: Hieracium sagittatum subsp. scalenum, commonly known as the arrowhead hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lanceolate leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive arrowhead shape. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and is often found in temperate climates.
